alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 8:27AM EDT until July 29 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water enters the basement of a home off of Highway 30 on the right bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 34.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 19.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will rise to 20.1 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.1 feet on 03/23/1952. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued at noon today.
